Old Description: Configure firewalls/proxy servers to limit inbound and outbound traffic
New Description: Configure ALL information resources to limit inbound and outbound traffic
Notes: Expanded scope from firewalls/proxy to ALL information resources

Old Description: Design systems as logically segmented micro-services to minimize the attack surface and lateral movement if compromised
New Description: Design systems to minimize the attack surface and minimize lateral movement if compromised
Notes: Simplified wording, removed micro-services specificity

Old Description: Use cloud native virtual networks and related capabilities to enforce logical traffic flow controls
New Description: Use logical networking and related capabilities to enforce traffic flow controls
Notes: Removed "cloud native virtual" specification

Old Description: Use immutable containers and serverless functions with strictly defined functionality and privileges
New Description: Use immutable infrastructure with strictly defined functionality and privileges by default
Notes: Expanded from containers/serverless to all infrastructure, added "by default"

Old Description: Have denial of service (DoS) protection
New Description: Have denial of service protection
Notes: Minor formatting change (removed DoS abbreviation)

Old Description: Use high availability design principles to maximize uptime
New Description: Design systems for high availability and rapid recovery
Notes: Added "rapid recovery" component

New Description: Ensure cloud-native information resources are implemented based on host provider's best practices and documented guidance
Notes: New requirement for following provider best practices

Old Description: Execute continuous scanning of cloud native system components
Notes: Removed from CNA, may be covered in MLA section

Old Description: Harden and review network and system configurations
New Description: Harden and review network and system configurations

Old Description: Encrypt all network traffic
New Description: Encrypt or otherwise secure network traffic
Notes: Added "or otherwise secure" option

Old Description: Encrypt all federal and sensitive information at rest
New Description: Encrypt all federal and sensitive information at rest

Old Description: Manage configuration centrally
New Description: Manage configuration centrally

Old Description: Enforce system and component integrity through cryptographic means
New Description: Enforce system and information resource integrity through cryptographic means
Notes: Changed "component" to "information resource"

Old Description: Use a key management capability to execute regular rotation of digital keys
New Description: Use automated key management systems to manage, protect, and regularly rotate digital keys and certificates
Notes: Specified automation and added certificates, expanded scope

Old Description: Use a consistent, risk-informed approach for applying security patches
New Description: Use a consistent, risk-informed approach for applying security patches

Old Description: Enforce phishing-resistant multi-factor authentication (MFA)
New Description: Enforce multi-factor authentication (MFA) using methods that are difficult to intercept or impersonate (phishing-resistant MFA) for all user authentication
Notes: Added detailed explanation and scope to all user authentication

Old Description: Enforce strong passwords
New Description: Use secure passwordless methods for user authentication and authorization when feasible, otherwise enforce strong passwords with MFA
Notes: Prioritized passwordless methods, added MFA requirement for passwords

Old Description: Use secure API authentication methods via industry standard protocols
New Description: Enforce appropriately secure authentication methods for non-user accounts and services
Notes: Expanded from API-specific to all non-user accounts and services

Old Description: Use a least-privileged, role-based, and just-in-time security model
New Description: Use a least-privileged, role and attribute-based, and just-in-time security authorization model for all user and non-user accounts and services
Notes: Added attribute-based, specified authorization model, expanded scope

New Description: Apply zero trust design principles
Notes: New zero trust requirement (moved from 3IR section)

New Description: Automatically disable or otherwise secure accounts with privileged access in response to suspicious activity
Notes: New automated security response requirement

Old Description: Operate a Security Information and Event Management (SIEM) system for centralized, tamper-resistent event, activity, and change logging
New Description: Operate a Security Information and Event Management (SIEM) or similar system(s) for centralized, tamper-resistent logging of events, activities, and changes
Notes: Added "or similar system(s)" flexibility, reordered wording

Old Description: Regularly review and audit logs
New Description: Regularly review and audit logs

Old Description: Rapidly detect and remediate or mitigate vulnerabilities
New Description: Rapidly detect and remediate or mitigate vulnerabilities

Old Description: Perform authenticated vulnerability scanning on publicly accessible components
New Description: Perform authenticated vulnerability scanning on information resources
Notes: Expanded scope from publicly accessible components to all information resources

Old Description: Perform Infrastructure as Code (IaC) and configuration scanning
New Description: Perform Infrastructure as Code and configuration evaluation and testing
Notes: Changed "scanning" to "evaluation and testing"

Old Description: Centrally track and prioritize the remediation of identified vulnerabilities
New Description: Centrally track and prioritize the mitigation and/or remediation of identified vulnerabilities
Notes: Added "mitigation and/or" options

Old Description: Log and monitor system modifications
New Description: Log and monitor system modifications

Old Description: Execute changes though redeployment of version controlled immutable resources rather than direct modification wherever possible
New Description: Execute changes though redeployment of version controlled immutable resources rather than direct modification wherever possible

Old Description: Implement automated testing and validation of changes prior to deployment
New Description: Implement automated testing and validation of changes prior to deployment

Old Description: Have a documented change management procedure
New Description: Have a documented change management procedure

Old Description: Evaluate the risk and potential impact of any change
New Description: Evaluate the risk and potential impact of any change

Old Description: Have an up-to-date asset inventory or code defining all deployed assets
New Description: Have an up-to-date information resource inventory or code defining all deployed assets, software, and services
Notes: Changed to "information resource inventory", added software and services

Old Description: Have policies outlining their security objectives
New Description: Have policies outlining the security objectives of all information resources
Notes: Specified scope to "all information resources"

Old Description: Maintain a vulnerability disclosure program
New Description: Maintain a vulnerability disclosure program

Old Description: Build security considerations into the Software Development Lifecycle (SDLC) and aligning with Secure By Design principles
New Description: Build security considerations into the Software Development Lifecycle and align with CISA Secure By Design principles
Notes: Removed acronym, specified CISA, fixed grammar

Old Description: Document methods used to automatically evaluate implementations
New Description: Document methods used to evaluate information resource implementations
Notes: Removed "automatically", added "information resource"

Old Description: Have a dedicated staff and budget for security
New Description: Have a dedicated staff and budget for security with executive support, commensurate with the size, complexity, scope, and risk of the service offering
Notes: Added executive support requirement and risk-based sizing

New Description: Document risk management decisions for software supply chain security
Notes: New supply chain risk documentation requirement

Old Description: Regularly confirm that services storing Federal information are all FedRAMP authorized and securely configured
New Description: Identify all third-party information resources
Notes: Changed from FedRAMP verification to general identification requirement

New Description: Regularly confirm that services handling federal information or are likely to impact the confidentiality, integrity, or availability of federal information are FedRAMP authorized and securely configured
Notes: FedRAMP requirement moved here from old 3IR-1, expanded scope

Old Description: Identify and prioritize potential supply chain risks
New Description: Identify and prioritize mitigation of potential supply chain risks
Notes: Added "mitigation of"

Old Description: Obtain a Software Bill of Materials (SBOM) for third party commercial software components
New Description: Monitor third party software information resources for upstream vulnerabilities, with contractual notification requirements or active monitoring services
Notes: Completely changed from SBOM requirement to vulnerability monitoring

Old Description: Confirm that third party information resources have a Secure Software Development Attestation with CISA
Notes: Removed SSDF attestation requirement

Old Description: Implement zero trust design principles
Notes: Moved to IAM-05

Old Description: Ensure all employees receive security awareness training
New Description: Ensure all employees receive security awareness training

Old Description: Require role-specific training for high risk roles
New Description: Require role-specific training for high risk roles, including at least roles with privileged access
Notes: Added minimum requirement for privileged access roles

Old Description: Define Recovery Time Objective (RTO) and Recovery Point Objective (RPO)
New Description: Define Recovery Time Objectives (RTO) and Recovery Point Objectives (RPO)
Notes: Pluralized Objectives

New Description: Develop and maintain a recovery plan that aligns with the defined recovery objectives
Notes: New recovery plan requirement

Old Description: Perform system backups aligned with the RTO and RPO
New Description: Perform system backups aligned with recovery objectives
Notes: Simplified reference to objectives

Old Description: Test the capability to recover from incidents and contingencies
New Description: Regularly test the capability to recover from incidents and contingencies
Notes: Added "regularly"

Old Description: Report incidents according to federal requirements
New Description: Report incidents according to FedRAMP requirements and cloud service provider policies
Notes: Specified FedRAMP and added CSP policies

Old Description: Maintain a log of incidents and periodically review past incidents for patterns or vulnerabilities
New Description: Maintain a log of incidents and periodically review past incidents for patterns or vulnerabilities

Old Description: Measure Mean Time To Detect (MTTD) and Mean Time To Resolution (MTTR) for incidents
New Description: Generate after action reports and regularly incorporate lessons learned into operations
Notes: Changed from metrics to after-action reports and lessons learned
